naics.NAICS_Title: Instruments and Related Products Manufacturing for Measuring, Displaying, and Controlling Industrial Process Variables

data.procurementTitle: PRIMES GmbH ScanFieldMonitor Laser Diagnostic Instrument
data.summaryOfProcurement: The Production Systems Group (PSG) at NIST specializes in high-precision motion systems and manufacturing equipment. PSG requires a ScanFieldMonitor laser diagnostic instrument, manufactured by PRIMES GmbH, to characterize the laser performance of its powder bed fusion machines currently used in NIST’s additive manufacturing (AM) research. The ScanFieldMonitor laser diagnostic instrument manufactured by PRIMES GmbH is the only laser diagnostic instrument that can measure specific properties of the lasers that include the laser diameter at locations up to 20° off-normal and laser-galvanometer synchronization.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: The only instrument that has been identified that meets NIST's minimum requirements is PRIMES GmbH’s ScanFieldMonitor Laser Diagnostic Instrument that is manufactured by PRIMES GmbH, located in Germany. PRIMES, GmbH does not sell directly to customers in the United States and authorizes one (1) company, Laser Mechanisms, Inc., a small business, to sell it to U.S. customers.

data.summaryOfProcurement: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), Center for Devices and Radiological Health (CDRH) requires the purchase of a multi-angle spectrophotometer (MAS) to ensure center and agency-wide maximum, scientific research capacity. An MAS allows for the spectral measurement of object surface from different angles such that the measurement data can be used in augmented reality or virtual reality (AR/VR) devices to create realistic representation in medical applications. The MAS is required for measuring spectral reflectance of object surface from different angles. The multi-angle measurement data is required to reconstruct the virtual objects for the AR/VR devices to present the virtual scene from different angles corresponding to the viewer’s movement.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: Based on the findings, the aforementioned multi-angle spectrophotometer (MAS) is not produced or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and/or reasonably available commercial quantities; therefore, it is hereby determined, consistent with FAR 25.103(b), that this item is nonavailable.

data.summaryOfProcurement: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA), Office of Regulatory Affairs (ORA), the Arkansas Laboratory (ARKL), requires a benchtop centrifuge chemotherapeutic aquaculture shrimp analysis. The laboratory analyzes in excess of 400 samples per year using SOP-000695. This method requires samples to be centrifuged numerous times as part of the sample preparation process.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: Based on the results of the quotes received, it is determined that an item which meets the Government’s need is not produced or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and /or reasonable available commercial quantities and of a satisfactory quality. A domestically manufactured item is not available to meet the FDA’s need. Therefore, it is hereby determined, consistent with FAR 25.103(b), that these items are not available.

data.procurementTitle: QIAcube HT, High-throughput automated nucleic acid isolation/purification system
data.summaryOfProcurement: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA), Center for Biologics Evaluation and Research (CBER)’s laboratory of Vector-Borne Viral Diseases (LVVD) of Division of Viral Products conducts research on several important vector-borne viral pathogens, including Dengue, Zika, and West Nile viruses, SARS-CoV-2 (the causative agent of COVID-19). They often need to isolate DNA/RNA (nucleic acids) from cells as well as tissue homogenates generated from infected animals. Such a process is labor intensive and often takes several hours for researchers to process only a few tissue samples. A reliable high-throughput automated nucleic acid isolation/purification system with necessary safety features will greatly improve the laboratory’s efficiency. The laboratory requires a high-throughput fully automated nucleic acid isolation system with safety features and has identified an instrument they have determined can meet the laboratory’s requirements: the QIAcube HT or equal instrument.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: Based on the findings detailed above, the high-throughput automated nucleic acid isolation/purification system—the QIAcube HT is not produced or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and/or reasonably available commercial quantities; therefore, it is hereby determined, consistent with FAR 25.103(b), that this item is not available.

data.contractingOfficeAgencyName: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF STANDARDS AND TECHNOLOGY
data.fundingAgencyName: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF STANDARDS AND TECHNOLOGY
data.summaryOfProcurement: In the Information Technology Laboratory (ITL) at the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), research is performed in integrated quantum photonics. The NIST ITL Applied and Computational Mathematics Division (ACMD) seeks to understand the potential for quantum-based technology to transform computing and communications, and to develop the measurement and standards infrastructure necessary to exploit this potential. These experiments require a tunable, continuous-wave, narrow-linewidth laser in the telecommunications band near 1550 nm wavelength.  The purpose of this requirement is to acquire a Continuously Tunable Laser (CTL).
data.waiverRationaleSummary: No Domestic product has been identified that can meet the Governments requirements.

data.procurementTitle: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Office of the Principal Legal Advisor (OPLA), James C. Corman Federal Building, 6320 Van Nuys Boulevard, Level 1, Van Nuys, CA
data.summaryOfProcurement: Design build construction project that includes but is not limited to supervision, labor, materials, supplies, equipment, delivery, and transportation for the complete demolition, removal, and haul-out of existing interior partitions, finishes, and equipment; and fully functional new office spaces, conference rooms, IT storage room, finishes, power, data, HVAC, fire sprinkler, fire alarm, communication, lighting, interior signage(s) for the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Office of the Principal Legal Advisor (OPLA). Work includes asbestos abatement. Work also includes installation of an HVAC inverter-driven ductless mini split, or more specifically a 1.5-ton cooling only wall mounted mini split system.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: Based on the information provided by the contractor, designer, OEM; a review of procurement history; market research on GSA Advantage, and the Government’s need for cooling for the IT room for this project, an individual determination is made that the “HVAC inverter-driven ductless mini split, or more specifically a 1.5-ton cooling only wall mounted mini split system” is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality. This determination is made for this contract only.

data.procurementTitle: Automated Solid Phase Extraction (SPE) system for PFAS analysis
data.summaryOfProcurement: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA) Arkansas Laboratory (ARKL) is the sole servicing Office of Regulatory Affairs (ORA) lab for Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs) at the Food and Drug Administration (FDA).  ARKL will annually be analyzing more than 1,100 TDS samples and various animal feed and feed components for the presence of poly-fluorinated alkyl substances (PFAS), which are synthetic chemicals, referred to as forever chemicals, which are found in products like food packaging, household cleaners and nonstick cookware.  ARKL will annually be analyzing more than 1,100 Total diet study (TDS) samples and various animal feed and feed components. EPA Method 537.1 uses solid phase extraction (SPE) as part of the sample extraction/cleanup process. For this reason, ARKL requires an automated Solid Phase Extraction system with the flexibility to accommodate multiple method conditions.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: Based on the findings detailed above, the solid phase extraction (SPE) system is not produced or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and/or reasonably available commercial quantities; therefore, it is hereby determined, consistent with FAR 25.103(b), that these items are not available.

data.procurementTitle: The acquisition of custom 384-well TC treated barcoded plates to support ACTIVTrace and APP.
data.summaryOfProcurement:
The National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences (NCATS) is a part of the National Institutes of Health (NIH), which mission it is to catalyze the generation of innovative methods and technologies that will enhance the development, testing and implementation of diagnostics and therapeutics across a wide range of human diseases and conditions.

NCATS requires the acquisition of custom 384-well black, tissue culture treated, dual barcoded plates. These plates are continuously being used in ongoing screening assays on various robotic systems as well as offline; and they are well validated. The acquisition of these barcoded plates will allow scientists to support ongoing work for small molecule and combination screening, in silico virtual screening, nanobody/antibody design and optimization that are part of NCATS’s ongoing work to support the pandemic response. In addition, we are performing in vitro assays to support ACTIV Trace’s efforts to characterize the response of variant SARS-CoV2 viruses to current vaccine and therapeutic interventions.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: As market research has proven, the essential characteristics of the 384-well black, tissue culture treated, dual barcoded plates are only available through one source.  These plates are continuously being used in ongoing screening assays on various robotic systems as well as offline; they are well validated. These plates are need to continue the study and screening involved with the COVID-19 pandemic.

data.procurementTitle: Laboratory Air Compressors for the Sterling Field Support Center in Sterling, VA
data.summaryOfProcurement: The Government requires two new air compressor systems to support various operationally specific laboratory testing and calibration equipment utilized by the National Weather Service (NWS) at the Sterling Field Support Center (SFSC), Environmental Chamber Laboratory Temperature and Humidity Laboratory.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: The Government requires two new air compressor systems to support laboratory testing and calibration equipment utilized by the National Weather Service, Sterling Field Support Center, and Environmental Chamber Laboratory Temperature and Humidity Laboratory. Without these compressor systems, the Government would not be able to continue testing mission critical observation systems and complete sensor calibrations.

data.procurementTitle: Automated Nucleic Extraction System with 4 - Option Years of Extended Warranty Services
data.summaryOfProcurement:
Background: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), Center for Biologics Evaluation and Research (CBER), Division of Biological Standards and Quality Control (DBSQC) serves as a Standards Preparation and Testing laboratory of CBER. Lot release tests performed on these products require extraction of nucleic acid prior to performing PCR, sequencing, or product integrity tests. An automated nucleic acid extraction system is a closed system that ensures minimum extraction variability and protects the sample from contamination during extraction. This automated nucleic acid extraction system is intended for use in quantitative recovery of both RNA and DNA extractions from diverse sample types, including cell culture, raw material (i.e., serum), and vaccines in support of drug product testing for licensing, lot release, and other regulatory decisions of CBER.

CBER’s Division of Biological Standards and Quality Control (DBSQC), requires purchase of an Automated Nucleic Extraction System which includes installation, on-stie training and qualification, as well as four (4) 1-year options for extended warranty services on the instrument.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: Based on the findings of the market research, resulting from the requisition packet and sources sought notice and the posted solicitation, it is determined that an item which meets the Government’s need is not produced or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and /or reasonable available commercial quantities and of a satisfactory quality. A domestically manufactured item is not available to meet the FDA’s specific need. *Consistent with FAR 25.103(b).

data.summaryOfProcurement: The quantum measurement division requires one multichannel Time-Correlated SPC to serve as a data-collecting unit of an optical quantum node.  Each node will receive quantum signals from various quantum sources and because the nodes are physically separated, the timing of the arrival of the quantum signals becomes a critical issue. With a multichannel Time-Correlated SPC we can meet these requirements.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: No Domestic product has been identified that can meet the Governments requirements. The combined synopsis/solicitation included FAR 52.225-2, Buy American-Supplies. Germany does not fall under Buy American Act Supplies nor did the offeror certify compliance.   The required Multi-Channel Time Correlated SPC is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality.
